title: Password not checked when disabling 2FA on HackerOne

profile.name: HackerOne
profile.about: Vulnerability disclosure should be safe, transparent, and rewarding.

vulnerability_information:
Hi,

when I was submitted a report to a program that request `2FA` ON, I notice that if you try to disable this option will ask for `backup code - password` and if you enter a random password in the request filed and a correct `backup code` it will be successfully disabled the `2FA` without check if the password was correct or not.

#PoC
1. go to your account and activate the `2FA` from `/settings/auth`
2. after active this option click on `Disabled` icon beside `Two-factor authentication`.
3. a new window will open asking for `Authentication or backup code - Password` to confirm the disabled.
{F494646}
4. in the first box enter a valid `Authentication or backup code` and in the password filed enter any random/wrong password and click save.
5. the option will be disabled successful without check the validation of the password.
 
#graphql Request
```json

{"query":"mutation Destroy_two_factor_authentication_credentials_mutation($input_0:DestroyTwoFactorAuthenticationCredentialsInput!,$first_1:Int!,$throttle_time_2:Int!,$first_4:Int!,$size_3:ProfilePictureSizes!) {destroyTwoFactorAuthenticationCredentials(input:$input_0) {clientMutationId,...F1,...F2}} fragment F0 on User {id,totp_supported,totp_enabled,remaining_otp_backup_code_count,account_recovery_phone_number,username,name,_profile_picturePkPpF:profile_picture(size:$size_3)} fragment F1 on DestroyTwoFactorAuthenticationCredentialsPayload {me {id,user_type,_program_health_acknowledgements2aGZgn:program_health_acknowledgements(first:$first_1,throttle_time:$throttle_time_2) {edges {node {id,reason,team_member {user {id},id,team {handle,name,sla_failed_count,id}}},cursor},pageInfo {hasNextPage,hasPreviousPage}},new_feature_notification {name,description,url,id},...F0}} fragment F2 on DestroyTwoFactorAuthenticationCredentialsPayload {me {totp_enabled,remaining_otp_backup_code_count,id},was_successful,_errors3exXYb:errors(first:$first_4) {edges {node {type,field,message,id},cursor},pageInfo {hasNextPage,hasPreviousPage}}}",
"variables":{"input_0":{"password":"â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ","otp_code":"â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ","clientMutationId":"9"},"first_1":1,"throttle_time_2":3600,"first_4":100,"size_3":"small"}}
```

## Impact

user can disable `Two-factor authentication` without entering a valid password
vulnerability_information_html:
Hi,

when I was submitted a report to a program that request 2FA ON, I notice that if you try to disable this option will ask for backup code - password and if you enter a random password in the request filed and a correct backup code it will be successfully disabled the 2FA without check if the password was correct or not.

PoC

  1. go to your account and activate the 2FA from /settings/auth
  2. after active this option click on Disabled icon beside Two-factor authentication.
  3. a new window will open asking for Authentication or backup code - Password to confirm the disabled.
  4. in the first box enter a valid Authentication or backup code and in the password filed enter any random/wrong password and click save.
  5. the option will be disabled successful without check the validation of the password.

graphql Request


{"query":"mutation Destroy_two_factor_authentication_credentials_mutation($input_0:DestroyTwoFactorAuthenticationCredentialsInput!,$first_1:Int!,$throttle_time_2:Int!,$first_4:Int!,$size_3:ProfilePictureSizes!) {destroyTwoFactorAuthenticationCredentials(input:$input_0) {clientMutationId,...F1,...F2}} fragment F0 on User {id,totp_supported,totp_enabled,remaining_otp_backup_code_count,account_recovery_phone_number,username,name,_profile_picturePkPpF:profile_picture(size:$size_3)} fragment F1 on DestroyTwoFactorAuthenticationCredentialsPayload {me {id,user_type,_program_health_acknowledgements2aGZgn:program_health_acknowledgements(first:$first_1,throttle_time:$throttle_time_2) {edges {node {id,reason,team_member {user {id},id,team {handle,name,sla_failed_count,id}}},cursor},pageInfo {hasNextPage,hasPreviousPage}},new_feature_notification {name,description,url,id},...F0}} fragment F2 on DestroyTwoFactorAuthenticationCredentialsPayload {me {totp_enabled,remaining_otp_backup_code_count,id},was_successful,_errors3exXYb:errors(first:$first_4) {edges {node {type,field,message,id},cursor},pageInfo {hasNextPage,hasPreviousPage}}}",
"variables":{"input_0":{"password":"â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ","otp_code":"â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ","clientMutationId":"9"},"first_1":1,"throttle_time_2":3600,"first_4":100,"size_3":"small"}}

Impact

user can disable Two-factor authentication without entering a valid password

Hi @tester1231233,

Thank you for your submission. Your report is currently being reviewed and the HackerOne triage team will get back to you once there is additional information to share.

Kind regards,
@lasagna

activities.message:
Hi @tester1231233 

Thank you again for your report. I'm having difficulties trying to reproduce this. I've followed the steps exactly as you described, but I'm seeing a "password is invalid" error message when I provide an incorrect password. 

Can you check this again?

@lasagna

@lasagna

activities.message:
Hi @tester1231233 

This still does not work for me. Providing an invalid password _always_ gives me "incorrect" password. Are you sure you're not providing your real password here?
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @tester1231233

This still does not work for me. Providing an invalid password always gives me "incorrect" password. Are you sure you're not providing your real password here?

activities.message:
Hi @lasagna

I don't know if this happens only in my account or other accounts, but what I did was I am active the `2FA` then in the same time I am disabled the `2FA` or if may account REP make different here

this is a second video show the behavior and I had to include my password in the video to be sure that I am putting a wrong password and it's accepted it without any validation.

keep in mind that in the first **PoC** I had put password `123456` and in this video `12345678` which is sure not my password

â–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆâ–ˆ

activities.message:
Hello @tester1231233,

Thank you for your submission! We were able to validate your report, and have submitted it to the appropriate remediation team for review. They will let us know the final ruling on this report, and when/if a fix will be implemented. Please note that the status and severity are subject to change.

Regards,
@lasagna

additional_data.old_title: when disabled the Two-factor authentication there is no step to check if the password valid or not
additional_data.new_title: Password not checked when disabling 2FA on HackerOne

activities.message: Hey @tester1231233, nice find! We've pushed out a fix for this, can you confirm it's no longer exploitable? I'm reviewing a few other paths and was wondering if you found other cases in the 2FA setup that maybe have the same issue?
activities.markdown_message: Hey @tester1231233, nice find! We've pushed out a fix for this, can you confirm it's no longer exploitable? I'm reviewing a few other paths and was wondering if you found other cases in the 2FA setup that maybe have the same issue?

activities.message:
Hi @bencode ,

>>**nice find!**
thanks for these lovely words.




>**We've pushed out a fix for this**
Happy to hear that <3




**can you confirm it's no longer exploitable?**
just checked it and confirm that the `graphql` now check all fields in the request before process the request, so yes it's fixed now.


```json
was_successful false
_errors3exXYb {â€¦}
edges [â€¦]
0 {â€¦}
node {â€¦}
type ARGUMENT
field password
message is invalid
id Z2lkOi8vaGFja2Vyb25lL09iamVjdHM6OlNpbXBsZUVycm9yL3N0YXRpYw==
cursor MQ
pageInfo {â€¦}
hasNextPage false
hasPreviousPage false

```

**I'm reviewing a few other paths and was wondering if you found other cases in the 2FA setup that maybe have the same issue?**

I had checked all other steps for now there is nothing suspect or have similar issues like this, I will do more investigation and if I found something I will send it to you


>**I would like to ask if the severity of this report will be changed since this behavior is related to `GraphQL` as in other reports #342978 #343464**

thanks

activities.message:
> so yes it's fixed now

Great!

> I will do more investigation and if I found something I will send it to you

Thanks!

> I would like to ask if the severity of this report will be changed since this behavior is related to GraphQL as in other reports #342978 #343464

I reviewed the severity settings and the different is in the attack complexity. For this report it is high, given you'd have to have access to the users account and have one of their backup codes. In the other reports is does not require any special access, so the attack complexity is low.

I hope that makes sense.
activities.markdown_message:
so yes it's fixed now

Great!

I will do more investigation and if I found something I will send it to you

Thanks!

I would like to ask if the severity of this report will be changed since this behavior is related to GraphQL as in other reports #342978 #343464

I reviewed the severity settings and the different is in the attack complexity. For this report it is high, given you'd have to have access to the users account and have one of their backup codes. In the other reports is does not require any special access, so the attack complexity is low.

I hope that makes sense.
